## Public Member Functions

### canMerge() {#a481db3ca9a03829503a402a2318a27b1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool PPCBranchCoalescing::canMerge (CoalescingCandidateInfo &amp; SourceRegion, CoalescingCandidateInfo &amp; TargetRegion) const</>}>
This method determines whether the two coalescing candidates can be merged.

In order to be merged, all instructions must be able to
<ul>
<li>Move to the beginning of the SourceRegion.BranchTargetBlock;</li>
<li>Move to the end of the TargetRegion.BranchBlock. Merging involves moving the instructions in the TargetRegion.BranchTargetBlock (also SourceRegion.BranchBlock).</li>
</ul>


This function first try to move instructions from the TargetRegion.BranchTargetBlock down, to the beginning of the SourceRegion.BranchTargetBlock. This is not possible if any register defined in TargetRegion.BranchTargetBlock is used in a PHI node in the SourceRegion.BranchTargetBlock. In this case, check whether the statement can be moved up, to the end of the TargetRegion.BranchBlock (immediately before the branch statement). If it cannot move, then these blocks cannot be merged.

Note that there is no analysis for moving instructions past the fall-through blocks because they are confirmed to be empty. An assert is thrown if they are not.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="[in] SourceRegion">The candidate to move statements from</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="[in] TargetRegion">The candidate to move statements to</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
true if all instructions in SourceRegion.BranchBlock can be merged into a block in TargetRegion, false otherwise.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcbranchcoalescing-cpp/#l00181">181</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcbranchcoalescing-cpp">PPCBranchCoalescing.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### canMoveToBeginning() {#aa8661c8ac8b1cb3810a45d201972e5d5}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool PPCBranchCoalescing::canMoveToBeginning (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &amp; MI, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp; TargetMBB) const</>}>
This function checks if MI can be moved to the beginning of the TargetMBB following PHI instructions.

A MI instruction can be moved to beginning of the TargetMBB if there are no uses of it within the TargetMBB PHI nodes.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="[in] MI">the machine instruction to move.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="[in] TargetMBB">the machine basic block to move to</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
true if it is safe to move MI to beginning of TargetMBB, false otherwise.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcbranchcoalescing-cpp/#l00177">177</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcbranchcoalescing-cpp">PPCBranchCoalescing.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### canMoveToEnd() {#afd833dc91598d5a3c3f327b47b98a4cf}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool PPCBranchCoalescing::canMoveToEnd (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &amp; MI, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp; TargetMBB) const</>}>
This function checks if MI can be moved to the end of the TargetMBB, immediately before the first terminator.

A MI instruction can be moved to then end of the TargetMBB if no PHI node defines what MI uses within it&#39;s own MBB.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="[in] MI">the machine instruction to move.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="[in] TargetMBB">the machine basic block to move to</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
true if it is safe to move MI to end of TargetMBB, false otherwise.
</SectionUser>

### mergeCandidates() {#a072a336f973a3de4daa8fe16e5b4570f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool PPCBranchCoalescing::mergeCandidates (CoalescingCandidateInfo &amp; SourceRegion, CoalescingCandidateInfo &amp; TargetRegion)</>}>
Merge the instructions from SourceRegion.BranchBlock, SourceRegion.BranchTargetBlock, and SourceRegion.FallThroughBlock into TargetRegion.BranchBlock, TargetRegion.BranchTargetBlock and TargetRegion.FallThroughBlock respectively.

The successors for blocks in TargetRegion will be updated to use the successors from blocks in SourceRegion. Finally, the blocks in SourceRegion will be removed from the function.

A region consists of a BranchBlock, a FallThroughBlock, and a BranchTargetBlock. Branch coalesce works on patterns where the TargetRegion&#39;s BranchTargetBlock must also be the SourceRegions&#39;s BranchBlock.

Before mergeCandidates:

+------------------------—+ | TargetRegion.BranchBlock | +------------------------—+ / | / +-----------------------------—+ | | TargetRegion.FallThroughBlock | \\ +-----------------------------—+ \\ | +-------------------------------—+ | TargetRegion.BranchTargetBlock | | SourceRegion.BranchBlock | +-------------------------------—+ / | / +-----------------------------—+ | | SourceRegion.FallThroughBlock | \\ +-----------------------------—+ \\ | +-------------------------------—+ | SourceRegion.BranchTargetBlock | +-------------------------------—+

After mergeCandidates:

+--------------------------—+ | TargetRegion.BranchBlock | | SourceRegion.BranchBlock | +--------------------------—+ / | / +------------------------------—+ | | TargetRegion.FallThroughBlock | | | SourceRegion.FallThroughBlock | \\ +------------------------------—+ \\ | +-------------------------------—+ | SourceRegion.BranchTargetBlock | +-------------------------------—+


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="[in] SourceRegion">The candidate to move blocks from</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="[in] TargetRegion">The candidate to move blocks to</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcbranchcoalescing-cpp/#l00175">175</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcbranchcoalescing-cpp">PPCBranchCoalescing.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### moveAndUpdatePHIs() {#a2a11298ee3a7cfcfa678f8b9a3df20db}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void PPCBranchCoalescing::moveAndUpdatePHIs (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42; SourceMBB, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42; TargetMBB)</>}>
Moves ALL PHI instructions in SourceMBB to beginning of TargetMBB and update them to refer to the new block.

PHI node ordering cannot be assumed so it does not matter where the PHI instructions are moved to in TargetMBB.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="[in] SourceMBB">block to move PHI instructions from</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="[in] TargetMBB">block to move PHI instructions to</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

</MemberDefinition>

## Private Member Functions

### canCoalesceBranch() {#a8537fa42c3064c2c1ae3e4efae6bd532}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool PPCBranchCoalescing::canCoalesceBranch (CoalescingCandidateInfo &amp; Cand)</>}>
Analyze the branch statement to determine if it can be coalesced.

This method analyses the branch statement for the given candidate to determine if it can be coalesced. If the branch can be coalesced, then the BranchTargetBlock and the FallThroughBlock are recorded in the specified Candidate. 
<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="[inout] Cand">The coalescing candidate to analyze</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
true if and only if the branch can be coalesced, false otherwise
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcbranchcoalescing-cpp/#l00154">154</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcbranchcoalescing-cpp">PPCBranchCoalescing.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

## Public Static Attributes

### ID {#ae4a211cc96989f7db223bf7fc2e4df1a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="char PPCBranchCoalescing::ID = 0"
  labels = {["static"]}>
